text:
Hola friends! We recently created competence lead roles (for growth marketing, content & brand, paid acquisition, and marketing technology) at Advance B2B (growth marketing agency).

I’ve taken up the mantle for Content & Brand. Since it’s a new role, we’re developing different things, and I was wondering if anyone has experience with:
• Defining competencies for Content Specialists vs Content Strategists — Trying to define the differences between the roles and what skills/experience levels you need for each
    ◦ For those of you at agencies, do you have different content roles other than these? I’m thinking about proposing a Senior Content Strategist role 
• Career development plans for content positions at an agency
Thanks in advance for any advice or insight that you have!

text: do you really need that many people on the content side? I've previously analyzed probably over 500 job description for these roles and what I can tell you is that they largely depend on each company. The clearest way is to have a Content Strategist/marketing manager in charge of the strategy [blog and even social if there's no one taking care of this] and then have roles like Content Writer doing the actual writing. You can also call your writers Specialists but they should obviously do more things like editing, SEO optimization, etc.

text:
<@U019P0ADPCH> thank you for your feedback! I work at a growth marketing agency, so we do need several content specialists and strategists to manage all of our clients. Each content marketer typically manages content marketing for 3-4 clients at a time.

Our clients are on monthly retainers, so we are either supplementing their content marketing efforts, or in many cases, we are the clients’ content team. On each client team we typically have 1 growth marketing strategist/specialist plus 1 content marketing strategist/specialist.

text:
Thanks <@U019P0ADPCH>. Our Growth Marketing Strategists are typically in charge of strategy/client communication, unless it’s a content marketing only retainer, then our Content Marketing Strategists will also be in charge of strategy/comms. This cuts out any unnecessary middle-person, so we can work more closely with the client and be much more strategic with our content.

We hire content marketing specialists and strategists instead of just writers because we specialize in B2B SaaS growth marketing, so we want our content marketers to be able to do more than just write.

They need to understand the different client businesses and be able to create content that drives growth. That entails building strategies, knowing how to do content audits, understanding how to improve content for paid acquisition campaigns, coming up with distribution strategies for amplification, etc.

Hopefully that makes sense, and that’s why I’m trying to define the Content Marketing Specialist and Content Marketing Strategist roles. Yes the strategist is in charge of content strategy, but I want to make those competencies a bit more fleshed out and clear, and have milestones for specialists to complete in order to be promoted to a strategist. I’m also trying to understand how other agencies might create development paths for these type of roles.
